This guide is a simplified overview of '''all non-experimental changes''' in the [[Chase the Skies]] ({{JE}} 1.21.6 to 1.21.8), which assumes at least some familiarity with [[Spring to Life]] (''Java Edition'' 1.21.5), excluding experimental features in this version.

== Mobs ==
=== New ===
{|{{Simple Guide table|New Mobs}}
|-
|[[Happy ghast]]
|{{Animate|Happy Ghast.gif;Ghastling.gif|150px}}
|
* Does not spawn naturally. 
* Spawned by hydrated [[Dried Ghast|dried ghasts]].
|{{xp|1|3}} (when killed by a [[player]] or tamed [[wolf]])
|
* Baby happy ghasts are called "ghastlings".
* Can be ridden on using a [[harness]].
|}

===Changed ===
{|{{Simple Guide table|Changed Mobs}}
|-
|[[Ghast]]
|{{Animate|Ghast JE3 BE3.gif;Ghast shooting JE3 BE4.png|150px}}
|
* Texture resolution has been doubled to match the [[happy ghast]].
|-
|[[Wolf]], [[pig]] and [[sheep]]
|{{Animate|Wolf JE2 BE2.png;Pig JE3 BE2.png;White Sheep JE4 BE7.png|150px}}
|

|-
|[[Piglin]]
|[[File:Piglin.png|frameless|150px]]

== Non-mob entities ==
=== Changed ===
{|{{Simple Guide table|Changed Non-mob entities}}
|-
|General
|
|
* Projectiles now have a target tolerance margin that changes. For the first two ticks after the arrow is shot, there is no target tolerance margin. For every tick after that, the margin increases by 0.05 blocks until maxing out at 0.3 blocks.

== Gameplay ==
=== New ===
{|{{Simple Guide table|New Gameplay}}
|-
|[[Locator bar]]
|
* Can show the position of other [[player]]s in [[multiplayer]] as colored indicators. 
* If the target is on a significantly different Y-level, an arrow pointing to the target vertically appears over the indicator.
* Locator Bar changes based on the player's distance to its location. The further away the player to the waypoint, the smaller the icon shown on the locator bar.
* Players can prevent their positions from being shown in the locator bar; they can [[crouch|sneak]], wear a [[Head|mob head]] or [[carved pumpkin]], or be under the [[Invisibility]] effect.
|}

=== Changed ===
{|{{Simple Guide table|Changed Gameplay}}
|-
|[[Sounds]]
|
* Rules for when ambient desert blocks sounds play have been tweaked.
* The sound event {{cd|block.dried_ghast.hit}} has been removed.
* The following sounds have been renamed:

<code>entity/leashknot/break1</code> -> <code>entity/leashknot/unleash1</code>

<code>entity/leashknot/break2</code> -> <code>entity/leashknot/unleash2</code>

<code>entity/leashknot/break3</code> -> <code>entity/leashknot/unleash3</code>

<code>entity/leashknot/place1</code> -> <code>entity/leashknot/leash1</code>

<code>entity/leashknot/place2</code> -> <code>entity/leashknot/leash2</code>

<code>entity/leashknot/place3</code> -> <code>entity/leashknot/leash3</code>

* The following sound categories have been renamed:

<code>Friendly Creatures</code> -> <code>Friendly Mobs</code>

<code>Hostile Creatures</code> -> <code>Hostile Mobs</code>
|-
|[[Spectator mode]]
|
* Spectators will now teleport together with, but stop spectating, entities that move to other dimensions.
|-
|[[Cloud]]s
|
* The clouds texture no longer supports colored pixels.
* Clouds now exist all the way to the horizon (128 chunks, the max and default cloud render distance).
* Clouds rendering distance can now be configured independently of world/chunk render distance.
* The pattern of clouds has been changed.
|-
|[[Fog]]
|
* Fog is now applied to 3d HUD elements such as first person player hands and items in hands.
* It now becomes foggier when it rains.
* Fog was tweaked for improved atmospheric perspective.
|}
